title: Romario Benzar
text:
Romario Sandu Benzar (born 26 March 1992) is a Romanian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> club <a href="U.S.%20Lecce">Lecce</a>.
Club career.
Viitorul Constanța.
Benzar started playing football in the <a href="Gheorghe%20Hagi%20Football%20Academy">Gheorghe Hagi Academy</a> and made his debut for fellow team <a href="FC%20Viitorul%20Constan%C8%9Ba">Viitorul Constanța</a> in 2010. He won the <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a> in <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Liga%20I">2016–17</a>.
FCSB.
On 10 August 2017, <a href="FC%20Steaua%20Bucure%C8%99ti">FCSB</a> announced the signings of Benzar and his Viitorul Constanța teammate <a href="Drago%C8%99%20Nedelcu">Dragoș Nedelcu</a> for a combined <a href="Euro">€</a>2.7 million. Benzar penned a five-year deal with a €10 million <a href="buyout%20clause">buyout clause</a>.
He scored his first competitive goal with a <a href="Direct%20free%20kick">free kick</a> in a 2–1 <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Liga%20I">league</a> victory over <a href="SC%20Juventus%20Bucure%C8%99ti">Juventus București</a>.
Lecce.
On 30 June 2019, it was announced that Benzar had signed with newly promoted <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> side <a href="U.S.%20Lecce">Lecce</a> for a reported fee of €2,000,000.
Loan to Perugia.
On 20 January 2020, he joined <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> club <a href="A.C.%20Perugia%20Calcio">Perugia</a> on loan until the end of the 2019–20 season, with an option to purchase.
Loan to Viitorul.
On 24 September 2020 he was loaned to Viitorul.
International career.
Benzar made his debut for <a href="Romania%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Romania U17</a> on 21 September 2008, in a game against <a href="Denmark%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Denmark</a>.
He was part of the <a href="Romania%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">team</a> which played at the <a href="2011%20UEFA%20European%20Under-19%20Football%20Championship">2011 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship</a> in <a href="Romania">Romania</a>.
In September 2016, Benzar was selected in <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a>'s senior squad for the <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a> <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28UEFA%29">qualifier</a> against <a href="Montenegro%20national%20football%20team">Montenegro</a>.
Personal life.
Benzar is named after former Brazilian international <a href="Rom%C3%A1rio">Romário</a>. His younger brother, <a href="Daniel%20Benzar">Daniel</a>, is also a footballer.
Honours.
Club.
Viitorul Constanța
